intro: Epilobium tetragonum nothosubsp. semiadnatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved willow herb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its slender, quadrangular stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy surface. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, often wet environments such as marshes and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for wetland restoration and ecological studies.
